title: Los Angeles Times Investigation Exposes Wells Fargo's Pressure-Cooker Sales Culture
description: The Los Angeles Times published a groundbreaking investigation revealing Wells Fargo's aggressive sales culture that encouraged employees to open unauthorized accounts for customers. Reporter E. Scott Reckard's investigation, based on court records and interviews with 35 current and former employees, documented systematic fraud dating back to 2009. Despite whistleblower complaints and employee terminations, regulators failed to take comprehensive action for years.

sources.title: Q&A: Former LA Times reporter on story that led to $185 million Wells Fargo fine

title: Wells Fargo Hit with Record $185 Million Fine for Opening 2 Million Fake Accounts
description: The Consumer Financial Protection Bureau fined Wells Fargo $100 million (the largest penalty in CFPB history), while the Office of the Comptroller of the Currency added $35 million and Los Angeles City/County $50 million, totaling $185 million. The bank admitted employees opened over 2 million deposit and credit card accounts without customer authorization between 2011-2016, firing 5,300 employees while executives received millions in bonuses.

title: OCC Receives Consumer and Employee Complaints About Wells Fargo Sales Practices But Takes Limited Action
description: The Office of the Comptroller of the Currency received complaints from consumers and Wells Fargo employees alleging improper sales practices, forwarding them to supervision staff per standard practice. However, the OCC failed to launch a comprehensive investigation or enforcement action despite clear warning signs of systematic fraud. This regulatory failure allowed the misconduct to continue for four more years, affecting millions of consumers.
